admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Year 2000 Technical Assistance
            Project was originally approved by the Board for an amount
            of US$100 million on March 30, 1999. The loan became
            effective on June 23, 1999. The loan closed on December 31,
            2001 with only US$11.9 million disbursed. An amount of US$88
            million was cancelled at the request of the government
            before significant implementation of the project could be
            initiated. Due to extensive negotiations with the government
            over the Country Assistance Strategy, the project was
            delayed. The government made an internal decision in early
            1999 to finance the activities of the National Y2K project
            team outside of the World Bank project. Given the nature of
            the project and the precise timing that was required for
            implementation, the delay in project processing ultimately
            affected the effectiveness of the project and its implementation.
